pullRequest.body:
- Define left and two-sided ideals in a matrix ring.
- Show that two-sided matrix ideals are order-isomorphic to two-sided ideals in the base ring.
  This code is taken from FLT, from [here](https://github.com/ImperialCollegeLondon/FLT/blob/daac491a4fa817ec39595e0a5ce2240ceed940fc/FLT/for_mathlib/CrazySimple.lean).

---

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ asIdeal_matricesOver`
`+ equivMatricesOver`
`+ orderIsoMatricesOver`
`++ matricesOver`
`++ matricesOver_bot`
`++ matricesOver_monotone`
`++ matricesOver_strictMono_of_nonempty`
`++ matricesOver_top`
`++ mem_matricesOver`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
```

</details>
Probably "characterize ideals in matrix rings" would be a better title

> Probably "characterize ideals in matrix rings" would be a better title

Changed, though this PR does not characterize left ideals.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11381265012/job/31662281605)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11381265012/job/31662281259)

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
This file could also be `Mathlib.RingTheory.MatrixIdeal` or similar. If there are no desiderata I am unaware of, the present location seems fine.
Can you state this with `Monotone`? Presumably it's `StrictMono` if `Nonempty n`?

Done (yeah it's `StrictMono`). Another way to do this would be to bundle `matricesOver` as an order hom, like [TwoSidedIdeal.asIdeal](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/RingTheory/TwoSidedIdeal/Operations.html#TwoSidedIdeal.asIdeal). I don't like this as much because dot notation no longer works, and there is a [CanLift instance](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Order/Hom/Basic.html#OrderHom.canLift) for maps that are known to be Monotone. But maybe there is something we lose by unbundling? Also if one is to bundle, I feel like it should be bundled as the strongest possible structure. It should at least be a `BotTopHom` (except that doesn't exist).
Does this proof rely on this being `N o o`, or would `N i j` work too?

Any `i j` can work. Certainly the underlying construction of moving a particular entry to a specified position by multiplying with basis matrices is useful, though I'm not sure how useful it is when wrapped in this equivalence. Nevertheless I generalized it.

```suggestion
def orderIsoMatricesOver (o : n) : TwoSidedIdeal R o TwoSidedIdeal (Matrix n n R) where
  __ := equivMatricesOver o
  map_rel_iff' {I J} := by
    simp only [equivMatricesOver_apply]
    constructor
     intro le x xI
      specialize @le (of fun _ _ => x) (by simp [xI])
      letI : Inhabited n := o
      simpa using le
     intro IJ M MI i j
      exact IJ <| MI i j
```
or similar
I saw the `__ :=` elsewhere, but there is no hover-docstring so I don't know why this is preferrable. Could you point me to some documentation?
This is just a style concern; `__` is semanticaly identical to `with`, but in general `where` notation is preferred for structures where possible.

As a general comment, I'd recommend using `$M(R)$` for anything that isn't actually valid lean notation, since that will render more nicely in the docs, and avoid any confusion about why code in docstrings doesn't actually work.

```suggestion
theorem matricesOver_strictMono_of_nonempty [Nonempty n] :
    StrictMono (matricesOver (R := R) n) :=
  matricesOver_monotone n |>.strictMono_of_injective <| fun I J eq => by
    ext x
    have : ( _ _, x  I)  ( _ _, x  J) := congr((Matrix.of fun _ _ => x)  $eq)
    simpa only [forall_const] using this
```

I think the following syntax should also work
```suggestion
    { N i j | N  J }
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(LinearAlgebra/Matrix): characterize ideals in matrix rings
